hero.kicker: Retracing the Silk Road on foot
hero.subtitle: The first human to run across Asia and Europe. One woman. Seventeen countries. Pacific to Atlantic.

story.title: The Story
story.paragraph1: Two years ago, Ria Xi couldn't get out of bed. Burned out from her tech career in Silicon Valley, she started running as a 30-day challenge after a breakup.
story.paragraph2: Within a year, she went from struggling to finish a half marathon to setting Fastest Known Times on world-renowned routes. The Via Francigena: 1,014 km in 21 days. The Camino de Santiago: 780 km in 12 days.
story.highlight: Now she's attempting the impossible: running 20,000 kilometers from Vladivostok to Lisbon, retracing the ancient Silk Road on foot.

empowerment.title: Women's Empowerment
empowerment.desc: The first woman-led ultra-distance crossing of the Eurasian continent.

mentalHealth.title: Mental Health
mentalHealth.desc: Proof that movement and ambitious goals can rebuild a sense of meaning.

support.description: From the Pacific to the Atlantic. 20,000 kilometers of ancient trade routes, mountain passes, and human stories. Your contribution funds the support vehicle, crew logistics, visas across 17 countries, and the documentary film capturing every step.
support.note: All unused funds will be returned to supporters proportionally.
